This is an unofficial, abridged outline of the Dawn of Everything.

Theories

  • We can choose to live differently
    • Our past is more diverse than our present
    • The "agricultural revolution" was slow and reversible
    • Scale doesn't determine social organization
    • Seasonality shows our capacity to deliberately change how we live
    • Eccentricity is socially useful
    • Matriarchy isn't rare
    • Culture is what we don't do
    • Three fundamental freedoms: movement, disobedience, and imagination
  • Indigenous American critics sparked the European Enlightenment
    • Indigenous American criticism was (initially) about freedom, not equality
    • "Social Equality" was invented to neutralize the Indigenous American criticism of European society
    • Equality is vague and bad
  • Origins of Domination
    • Slavery preserves violence by embedding it in social reproduction
    • Private property first emerged in sacred rituals
    • Sovereignty is the control of violence
    • Charisma is the control of legitimacy
    • Bureaucracy is the control of information
